title: Monsoon Update ‚Äì Heavy Rainfall with Thunderstorms Predicted in 14 States Two Days - Times Bull
article_text:
Monsoon Update ‚Äì A Western Disturbance has activated in most parts of North India, bringing overcast skies. Meanwhile, the effects of Cyclone Montha have subsided, but two new systems have become active, disrupting the weather across much of the country.

Due to this Western Disturbance, rain and snowfall are expected in Jammu and Kashmir, Uttarakhand, and Himachal Pradesh. Snowfall is already ongoing in the hilly areas, where winter has intensified significantly. Clouds are poised to drench people again in South India. Rain and wind are expected in several states. Find out what the weather will be like in these states.

Heavy Rain Alert in These States

The Meteorological Department has issued an alert for severe weather activity for November 5th and 6th. For two days, Delhi-NCR, Haryana, Punjab, and Rajasthan may experience cloudy weather. Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, and Kashmir may experience cloudy weather, along with snowfall and rain.

Dark clouds and rain are expected in parts of Uttar Pradesh and Bihar. The IMD has predicted rain in several areas of Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Karnataka, and Tamil Nadu in the south. Rain is possible in Manipur, Puducherry, Nagaland, and Mizoram. Rain and thundershowers are forecast in Tripura, Arunachal Pradesh, and Sikkim. The next 48 hours could be a disaster for all these states.

What is the weather like in Delhi-NCR?

The IMD has predicted partly cloudy skies in Delhi-NCR in November due to a western disturbance. The IMD has predicted a minimum temperature of 17 to 18 degrees Celsius and a maximum of 30 degrees Celsius. The pollution level in Delhi-NCR has crossed the 410 AQI.

UP Weather

According to the Meteorological Department, cloudy conditions are expected in Uttar Pradesh until November 6. A new western disturbance is likely to become active here. Thunderstorms are expected later today, November 5th. According to the IMD, fog may prevail during the night and morning hours from Uttar Pradesh to western Uttar Pradesh.

Weather in Himachal

The Meteorological Department has predicted another western disturbance to become active in the mountains. The IMD has issued a warning for rain and snowfall in Jammu and Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh, and Uttarakhand. On November 5th, Himachal Pradesh will be overcast, and some areas may experience rain and snowfall. The IMD has issued a rain alert for Kullu, Mandi, Una, Shimla, Hamirpur, Solan, Kangra, and Chamba.

title: Monsoon Update - Heavy Rain Alert in 13 States, Warning Snowfall & Thunderstorm Nov 5, 6 & 7 - Times Bull
article_text:
Monsoon Update: The weather across the country is rapidly changing. The activation of a Western Disturbance in the Himalayan region has brought significant changes to the weather. The Meteorological Department has issued a warning of snowfall and rain in hilly states such as Jammu and Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh, and Uttarakhand. A low-pressure system in the Bay of Bengal has triggered a yellow alert for heavy rain in southern states. Meanwhile, pollution levels in Delhi are severe, while light rain is expected in Rajasthan, Punjab, and Haryana. Dry weather is expected in many areas of North India, with a severe winter expected soon.
The Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert for heavy rain in Tamil Nadu on Wednesday. Meanwhile, weather changes are also expected in the northeastern states of Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura, as well as in Konkan, Goa, and Central Maharashtra.
Snowfall Alert
The Meteorological Department predicts that due to the impact of a western disturbance, higher elevations in the mountains may experience snowfall. In comparison, lower elevations may experience a new round of rain. According to the IMD, snowfall in the mountains and rain and strong winds in the plains may cause a drop in minimum temperatures. However, dry weather is expected in most states of North India after November 5th. Severe winters may begin after November 10th.
The IMD has issued an alert for thunderstorms and rain in the hilly states from November 5th to November 7th. Strong winds of up to 40-50 kilometres per hour are also possible in Jammu and Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh, and Uttarakhand.

Rain warning in these states
According to the Meteorological Department, thunderstorms accompanied by lightning are also expected in Konkan and Goa, as well as Central Maharashtra, on November 5th and 6th. The Meteorological Department predicts that thunderstorms accompanied by lightning are likely to occur in Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura on November 5th. Rain and thunderstorm alerts have also been issued for coastal Andhra Pradesh, Yanam, Rayalaseema, and northern and southern interior Karnataka.

According to the India Meteorological Department, light to moderate rain and snowfall may occur at isolated places in the Western Himalayan region until November 5th. An alert has also been issued for lightning and strong winds in Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh, Gilgit-Baltistan, and Muzaffarabad.
Weather Conditions in Rajasthan, Punjab, and Haryana
The IMD has issued an alert for light rain and thunderstorms in several districts of Rajasthan. The Meteorological Department has issued an alert for light rain in Jaipur, Bharatpur, Udaipur, Ajmer, and Kota districts. Dry weather is expected in most parts of Rajasthan for the next week. Apart from this, there is a possibility of lightning and strong winds in Haryana and Punjab as well.
